thread.title: InventHelp Inventor Develops Tablet-Computer Accessory (LGI-1925)
thread.title_full: InventHelp Inventor Develops Tablet-Computer Accessory (LGI-1925) - CBS News 8 - San Diego, CA News Station - KFMB Channel 8

author: cbs8
title: InventHelp Inventor Develops Tablet-Computer Accessory (LGI-1925)
text:
InventHelp, based in Pittsburgh, is submitting this idea, THE GLOVE, to companies for their review and potential feedback.
PITTSBURGH, PA
"I needed a better way to support my tablet computer while using it," said an inventor from Astoria, N.Y. "I thought about how to solve the problem of the tablet slipping out of my hand, and to avoid touching other keys, which led me to develop this convenient accessory."
He developed THE GLOVE to enable the user to hold a tablet computer or other hand-held electronic devices securely. This prevents it from being dropped. The device ensures that you have a firm grip on the tablet, which makes it easier to use a tablet computer for general purposes. The unit provides added peace of mind. Additionally, it is designed for easy, comfortable use.
The original design was submitted to the Long Island office of InventHelp. It is currently available for licensing or sale to manufacturers or marketers. For more information, write Dept. 14-LGI-1925, InventHelp, 217 Ninth Street, Pittsburgh, PA 15222, or call (412) 288-1300 ext. 1368. Learn more about InventHelp's Invention Submission Services at http://www.InventHelp.com - https://www.youtube.com/user/inventhelp
